4. Terrance Johnson

Terrance Johnson
================

Terrance Johnson, Council Member, Place 1
-----------------------------------------

**Phone:** 972-736-2416  
[Email Terrance Johnson](mailto:tjohnson@princetontx.us)

Terrance Johnson is a Dallas, Texas, native and alumnus of Woodrow Wilson High School. He began his higher education at Texas A&M Universityâ€“Commerce in 2004, pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a minor in English.Â This academic foundation continues to inform his approach to leadership, communication, and public service.

In 2013, Mr. Johnson relocated to Collin County to help launch a faith-based youth organization focused on mentorship, character development, and community engagement. Through this work, he cultivated strong partnerships among families, volunteers, and local stakeholders and emerged as a trusted leader committed to creating opportunities for young people and strengthening civic collaboration.

In 2021, Mr. Johnson was appointed to the Princeton Economic Development Corporation (PEDC), where he later served as Board Chair. In this role, he made history as the organizationâ€™s first African American chairman, providing strategic leadership on economic growth initiatives while emphasizing transparency, accountability, and inclusive community development.

Mr. Johnson is also a graduate of the Leadership McKinney Class of 2023, a flagship civic leadership program of the McKinney Chamber of Commerce that prepares emerging leaders to address regional challenges through informed, collaborative governance.

He is married to Yasma Johnson, a fellow Texas A&M Universityâ€“Commerce alumna, and together they are raising two daughters who attend Princeton ISD schools. As a husband, father, and public servant, Mr. Johnson remains deeply invested in policies and decisions that enhance the quality of life, educational opportunity, and long-term prosperity for Princeton families.
